Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: But I did change on that, and — and I’m glad I did.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: IFILL
Text: Governor?

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: There have been times where, as mayor and governor, we have passed budgets that I did not veto and that I think could be considered as something that I quasi-caved in, if you will, but knowing that it was the right thing to do in order to progress the agenda for that year and to work with the legislative body, that body that actually holds the purse strings.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: So there were times when I wanted to zero-base budget, and to cut taxes even more, and I didn’t have enough support in order to accomplish that.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: But on the major principle things, no, there hasn’t been something that I’ve had to compromise on, because we’ve always seemed to find a way to work together. Up there in Alaska, what we have done is, with bipartisan efforts, is work together and, again, not caring who gets the credit for what, as we accomplish things up there.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: And that’s been just a part of the operation that I wanted to participate in. And that’s what we’re going to do in Washington, D.C., also, bring in both sides together. John McCain is known for doing that, also, in order to get the work done for the American people.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: IFILL
Text: Let’s come full circle. You both want to bring both sides together. You both talk about bipartisanship. Once again, we saw what happened this week in Washington. How do you change the tone, as vice president, as number-two?

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: Well, again, I believe John McCain, were he here — and this is a dangerous thing to say in the middle of an election — but he would acknowledge what I’m about to say.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: I have been able to work across the aisle on some of the most controversial issues and change my party’s mind, as well as Republicans’, because I learned a lesson from Mike Mansfield.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: Mike Mansfield, a former leader of the Senate, said to me one day — he — I made a criticism of Jesse Helms. He said, “What would you do if I told you Jesse Helms and Dot Helms had adopted a child who had braces and was in real need?” I said, “I’d feel like a jerk.”

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: He said, “Joe, understand one thing. Everyone’s sent here for a reason, because there’s something in them that their folks like. Don’t question their motive.”

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: I have never since that moment in my first year questioned the motive of another member of the Congress or Senate with whom I’ve disagreed. I’ve questioned their judgment.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: I think that’s why I have the respect I have and have been able to work as well as I’ve been able to have worked in the United States Senate. That’s the fundamental change Barack Obama and I will be bring to this party, not questioning other people’s motives.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: IFILL
Text: Governor?

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: You do what I did as governor, and you appoint people regardless of party affiliation, Democrats, independents, Republicans. You — you walk the walk; you don’t just talk the talk.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: And even in my own family, it’s a very diverse family. And we have folks of all political persuasion in there, also, so I’ve grown up just knowing that, you know, at the end of the day, as long as we’re all working together for the greater good, it’s going to be OK.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: But the policies and the proposals have got to speak for themselves, also. And, again, voters on November 4th are going to have that choice to either support a ticket that supports policies that create jobs.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: You do that by lowering taxes on American workers and on our businesses. And you build up infrastructure, and you rein in government spending, and you make our — our nation energy independent.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: Or you support a ticket that supports policies that will kill jobs by increasing taxes. And that’s what the track record shows, is a desire to increase taxes, increase spending, a trillion-dollar spending proposal that’s on the table. That’s going to hurt our country, and saying no to energy independence. Clear choices on November 4th.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: IFILL
Text: Governor Palin, you get the chance to make the first closing statement.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: Well, again, Gwen, I do want to thank you and the commission. This is such an honor for me.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: And I appreciate, too, Senator Biden, getting to meet you, finally, also, and getting to debate with you. And I would like more opportunity for this.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: I like being able to answer these tough questions without the filter, even, of the mainstream media kind of telling viewers what they’ve just heard. I’d rather be able to just speak to the American people like we just did.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: And it’s so important that the American people know of the choices that they have on November 4th.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: I want to assure you that John McCain and I, we’re going to fight for America. We’re going to fight for the middle-class, average, everyday American family like mine.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: I’ve been there. I know what the hurts are. I know what the challenges are. And, thank God, I know what the joys are, too, of living in America. We are so blessed. And I’ve always been proud to be an American. And so has John McCain.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: We have to fight for our freedoms, also, economic and our national security freedoms.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: It was Ronald Reagan who said that freedom is always just one generation away from extinction. We don’t pass it to our children in the bloodstream; we have to fight for it and protect it, and then hand it to them so that they shall do the same, or we’re going to find ourselves spending our sunset years telling our children and our children’s children about a time in America, back in the day, when men and women were free.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: PALIN
Text: We will fight for it, and there is only one man in this race who has really ever fought for you, and that’s Senator John McCain.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: IFILL
Text: Thank you, Governor. Senator Biden.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: Gwen, thank you for doing this, and the commission, and Governor, it really was a pleasure getting to meet you.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: Look, folks, this is the most important election you’ve ever voted in your entire life. No one can deny that the last eight years, we’ve been dug into a very deep hole here at home with regard to our economy, and abroad in terms of our credibility. And there’s a need for fundamental change in our economic philosophy, as well as our foreign policy.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: And Barack Obama and I don’t measure progress toward that change based on whether or not we cut more regulations and how well CEOs are doing, or giving another $4 billion in tax breaks to the Exxon Mobils of the world.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: We measure progress in America based on whether or not someone can pay their mortgage, whether or not they can send their kid to college, whether or not they’re able to, when they send their child, like we have abroad — or I’m about to, abroad — and John has as well, I might add — to fight, that they are the best equipped and they have everything they need. And when they come home, they’re guaranteed that they have the best health care and the best education possible.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: You know, in the neighborhood I grew up in, it was all about dignity and respect. A neighborhood like most of you grew up in. And in that neighborhood, it was filled with women and men, mothers and fathers who taught their children if they believed in themselves, if they were honest, if they worked hard, if they loved their country, they could accomplish anything. We believed it, and we did.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: That’s why Barack Obama and I are running, to re-establish that certitude in our neighborhoods.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: Ladies and gentlemen, my dad used to have an expression. He’d say, “champ, when you get knocked down, get up.”

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: Well, it’s time for America to get up together. America’s ready, you’re ready, I’m ready, and Barack Obama is ready to be the next president of the United States of America.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BIDEN
Text: May God bless all of you, and most of all, for both of us, selfishly, may God protect our troops.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: IFILL
Text: That ends tonight’s debate. We want to thank the folks here at Washington University in St. Louis, and the Commission on Presidential Debates.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: IFILL
Text: There are two more debates to come. Next Tuesday, October 7th, with Tom Brokaw at Belmont University in Nashville, and on October 15th at Hofstra University in New York, with Bob Schieffer.

Title: October 2, 2008 Debate Transcript
Participants: SEN. JOSEPH R. BIDEN JR. (DE) DEMOCRATIC VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE GOV. SARAH PALIN, (AK) REPUBLICAN VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: IFILL
Text: Thank you, Governor Palin and Senator Biden. Good night, everybody.
